Topic.Title: why isn't Romney releasing the tax returns?

Message.Msg: Reagan , and other Presidents didn't release anything and nobody has released more than the two years tax returns Romney has. What is the point. There is a controversy, that Trump and Root were talking about , this points out that Obama was a foreign student at Columbia, same as at Occidental College. This opens up many questions Romney should call a press conference and issue a challenge in front of the nation. He should agree to release more of his tax returns, only if Obama unseals his college records. Simple and straight-forward. Mitt should ask “What could possibly be so embarrassing in your college records from 29 years ago, that you are afraid to let America’s voters see it? If it’s THAT bad, maybe it’s something the voters ought to see.” Suddenly the tables are turned. Now Obama is on the defensive. I can only think of one answer that would explain this mystery. Here’s my gut belief: Obama got a leg up by being admitted to both Occidental and Columbia as a foreign exchange student. He was raised as a young boy in Indonesia. But did his mother ever change him back to a U.S. citizen? When he returned to live with his grandparents in Hawaii or as he neared college-age preparing to apply to schools, did he ever change his citizenship back? I’m betting not. If you could unseal Obama’s Columbia University records I believe you’d find that: A) He rarely ever attended class. B) His grades were not those typical of what we understand it takes to get into Harvard Law School. C) He attended Columbia as a foreign exchange student. D) He paid little for either undergraduate college or Harvard Law School because of foreign aid and scholarships given to a poor foreign students like this kid Barry Soetoro from Indonesia. If you think I’m “fishing” then prove me wrong. Open up your records Mr. President. What are you afraid of? It’s time for Mitt to go on the attack and call Obama’s bluff.

Topic.Title: Obama raising taxes on every single American

Message.Msg: Wrong again,Shytferd. Only ONE Justice out of the nine (~11% of the court) reached the conclusion that you incorrectly attribute to the majority. The four left-of-center Justices found that Obamacare's individual mandate was a legitimate exercise of the commerce clause power, and so didn't opine on whether or not it might also be supported as a legitimate exercise of the taxing and spending power. The four other (arch)conservative Justices found (necessarily and explicitly) that the individual mandate and associated noncompliance penalty was NOT a tax: otherwise they would have had to uphold it as constitutional. In fact, of the nine Justices, only Chief Justice Roberts found that the individual mandate "can be read" as a tax, hence should be upheld under the principal of judicial restraint and deferral to the legislative branch. In fact, Mitt Romney (aka Myth RobMe) HIMSELF states conclusively that the individual mandate is not a tax. However, Mitt Romney (aka Governor Etch-a-Sketch) strongly disagrees with this position.
